document: Rules & Regulations for Students - Student Discipline
applies_to: All students of all Constituent Institutions of Indus University

terms.student: A student admitted in any constituent institution of the University at any level — Certificate, Diploma, Under-graduate, or Post-graduate.
terms.institution: A Constituent Institution established under Indus University at UG, PG, Diploma, or Certificate level — whether on campus or off campus.
terms.head_of_institution: The Director or any other person authorised by the University Management to be the Head of the respective Institute.
terms.hostel: The hostel managed or recognised by Indus University, either within the University premises or outside the campus.
terms.term: A portion of an academic year, normally coinciding with a semester. 'Term' and 'Semester' are used synonymously.
terms.ragging: Any disorderly conduct — by words spoken or written, or by an act — that teases, handles with rudeness, or causes annoyance, hardship, or psychological harm to a fresher or junior student; or asks them to perform something they would not ordinarily do, causing shame or embarrassment that adversely affects their physique or psyche.

key_rules: All students must observe and abide by the disciplinary rules prescribed by the University/Institute.
Every student must submit a Declaration (Enclosure-1) at the time of joining, accepting disciplinary jurisdiction of the Director/Head of the Institute.
Every student and their parent/guardian must sign an Anti-Ragging Undertaking (Enclosure-2) at the time of admission.
Students must be polite individually and in groups, and show respect to University authorities, colleagues, faculty, and staff.
Failure to maintain appropriate conduct will attract strict disciplinary action irrespective of gender.
Students must observe silence within the campus as various courses run simultaneously.
Students must possess and wear a Student Identity Card with photograph, duly attested by the Registrar, at all times inside the campus.
Attendance at all classes, sessions, prayers, and co-curricular activities is mandatory on all working days.
Absence due to illness requires a medical certificate; other absence requires a leave application from the parent/guardian submitted to the HOD/Director.
Students must not chat among themselves while a class is in progress.
Students must not use insulting, inciting, or threatening language with fellow students and must abstain from violence.
Students must not act or speak outside the institution in a way that brings disrepute to the University.
Indiscipline or misbehaviour in classrooms, campus, bus, or outside campus warrants disciplinary action.
Complaints and grievances may be submitted in writing to the Registrar/Director through the HOD or the Discipline-cum-Grievance Committee.
No meeting or function shall be held in the University premises without written permission of the Principal.
No notice shall be circulated or displayed without written permission of the Director/Head of the Institute.
No information or report shall be sent to the press or broadcasting agencies without the Principal's permission and approval.
Students who organise or assist in strikes will be dealt with strictly by the Director/Head of the Institute.
Students are expected to take all assignments, tests, and examinations seriously.
Interference in regular administration of the Institute is strictly prohibited.
Disfiguration or damage to University/Institute property or belongings of staff or students is strictly prohibited.
No student shall indulge in illegal activity or activity leading to disorderliness.
Possession or consumption of liquor, intoxicants, illicit drugs, or weapons on campus is strictly prohibited. Violators face strictest punishment.
Smoking, chewing pan, tobacco, or gutkha is strictly prohibited in University premises.
Indecent behaviour by any student or group will result in strict disciplinary action.
Use of mobile phones is strictly prohibited in classrooms, corridors, inside blocks, or anywhere on campus premises.
Video shooting, photography, playing musical instruments, or listening to radio/tape recorder during working/study hours is prohibited without prior permission.
Students must not involve themselves directly or indirectly in any form of politics inside or outside college during their study period. Violation may result in rustication.
Students must be in classrooms/labs/study areas on time before the commencement of study.
Wearing a helmet is compulsory for all two-wheeler riders to and from the campus.
Students must follow a decent dress code when coming to the University.
Any form of ragging in class, campus, bus, or outside campus is strictly prohibited.
Any misuse of Internet, intranet, computer software, or mobile is strictly prohibited.
Disobeying instructions of the HOD or Head of the Institution is considered an act of indiscipline.
Misconduct during examination, production of false information/documents for admission, and failure to return loaned materials or settle debts will attract the strictest action.

key_points: Ragging in any form is strictly prohibited.
If a ragging incident comes to the authority's notice, the student will be given a chance to explain. If the explanation is unsatisfactory, the student will be expelled from the Institute/University.
At the time of admission, every student and their parent/guardian must sign a declaration submitting to the disciplinary jurisdiction of the Principal.
All disciplinary powers are vested in the Executive President (VC) & Registrar. Their decision is final in all punishment matters.
If individuals involved in ragging are not identified, collective punishment may be imposed as a deterrent.
Ragging conviction will be mentioned in the student's migration certificate.

key_rules: Students must attend all classes regularly and punctually.
Students arriving more than 5 minutes late will not be given attendance for that period.
Minimum attendance prescribed by the University is 80%. The Institute insists on regular attendance.
Students with less than 80% attendance are not eligible to write Semester Examinations.
Students are not permitted to remain absent without prior permission.
Leave applications must be submitted in the prescribed form well in advance, or at least one day before the leave.
If prior permission is not possible, the leave application must be submitted on the day of return.
Even with prior permission, absence for even a single hour will be counted as absence for the whole session.
Absence without leave for any part of the day counts as a full day's absence.
Students without an Identity Card or proper uniform will be marked absent.
If a student is absent for 3 consecutive days without leave, their name will be removed from the rolls.
Removal from rolls results in forfeiture of attendance up to the date of re-admission.
Violations may result in: warning, fail mark for assignment/course, suspension, expulsion, withholding of official documents, withdrawal of campus privileges.
The library is open to all students, faculty, and staff of Indus University.
Readers are not allowed to enter the library with personal belongings.
Any activity that disturbs other readers will result in severe disciplinary action.
No reader shall write upon, damage, or make marks on any library book.
Each student is issued two library tickets. A book is lent only in exchange for one ticket.
Library tickets are not transferable. Lost tickets require payment of Rs. 50 as fine to obtain a replacement.
Overdue fine is 50 paisa per day. Students with overdue books cannot use the library until the book is returned and fine is paid.
Students must return all library books before receiving their hall ticket for End Semester Examination. A No Due clearance certificate from the Librarian is mandatory.
Provisional Diploma and Certificate will be issued only after all books are returned and dues are cleared.
A book may be renewed for a further fortnight if no other reader has applied for it; maximum 2 consecutive renewals are allowed.
For high-demand books, the loan period may be reduced to 15 days.
The Librarian may recall any book at any time even before the loan period expires.
Sub-lending of library books is not allowed.
Dictionaries, difficult-to-replace books, and reference books shall not be loaned.
Students are responsible for any damage to library books. If replacement is not possible, four times the value of the book/property will be collected.

general_rules: Students must conduct themselves in a manner that does not cause offence or inconvenience to others on campus.
Students must observe complete discipline inside the hostel and must not make wasteful or destructive use of amenities (water, electricity, furniture). Damage costs will be recovered.
Students must not breach the privacy of or cause inconvenience to fellow residents.
Students must be in the Campus/Hostel premises by the designated time decided by the competent authority.
No waste paper or rubbish should be thrown in or around the hostel. Lights must be switched off when leaving the room.
A student shall only occupy the room allotted to them and must not change it.

Hostel students must not stay overnight outside the hostel without written permission from the official designated by the Head of the Institution, including the address and phone number of the overnight location.
Boys and girls may interact only in designated areas. Entry into each other's rooms is strictly prohibited.
Ragging in the hostel or campus is strictly prohibited and may result in expulsion from both hostel and institute/university.
Gambling, possession and use of alcohol and narcotics anywhere in the hostel premises is strictly prohibited and will be dealt with under state laws.
No celebrations or social gatherings shall be held in the hostel without prior permission of the Head of the Institution.
All complaints about hostel staff must be made to the warden. Students must not abuse or assault staff.
additional_rules_for_girls: No visitor can be invited to a meeting or function without prior permission of the Head of the Institution.
Students wishing to stay out overnight or leave the station must apply in writing with the recommendation of a local guardian or parent.
No person other than local guardians and parents is allowed in the hostel premises during prescribed times.
No student will be permitted to enter after roll call without written permission from the warden.
Visitors must make an entry in the visitors' register even during prescribed visiting hours.
general_hostel_administrative_rules: Hostel accommodation is available only for the stipulated duration of the course. Students must vacate rooms at the end of each academic year.
Students must sign a receipt for furniture and fixtures. They are responsible for any damage. Items must be handed over to the warden at end of semester.
Students wanting to reserve rooms for the next semester must submit re-admission applications to the warden before vacation.
If a student locks the room with a private lock and leaves for vacation, the warden has the right to open the lock.
Final year students must vacate the hostel within 7 days of completing their final examination. Beyond this, a daily charge per room will be levied.
Security of personal belongings is the student's own responsibility. Theft must be reported immediately to the Warden and Director.
University officials have the right to inspect any hostel room at any time.
No guest is allowed to stay overnight in the hostel.
All payments (light bill, other charges) must be paid at the hostel office.
All visitors including non-resident students must record their visit details in the reception register.
Food will not be served in the hostel unless the student is sick and unable to move to the canteen.
All cases of sickness must be reported immediately to the warden/institute authority by the sick student and their roommate.
The University reserves the right to change room allocations or get rooms vacated at any time.
Visiting hours for guardians are determined by the University; guardians may meet students only in designated areas during these hours.
The University reserves the right to change any or all rules without prior notice.

regulation_3_indisciplinary_actions.title: Indisciplinary Actions - Major Penalty Triggers
actions_attracting_major_penalty: Involving in or instigating violence on or outside campus
Criminal acts such as using alcohol, drugs, gambling on or outside campus, or instigating others
Any act that deteriorates the overall campus atmosphere
Theft of University property or property of students, staff, or any other person on campus
Any other act of gross misconduct as determined by the Head of the Institution

regulation_4_procedure_for_major_penalti.title: Procedure for Imposing Major Penalties
steps: Head of Institution & Registrar are informed of the indisciplinary action.
Student is immediately suspended from classes, practicals, and academic activities.
A Fact Finding Committee is constituted by the Head of Institution to investigate within one week by examining students, parents, and witnesses.
If the charges are prima-facie proved, the report is submitted to a University-level committee constituted by the Registrar.
If the University-level committee confirms gross misconduct, it recommends a major penalty to the Registrar.
A Show Cause Notice is issued to the student.
After receiving the student's reply, the Registrar takes the final decision on the penalty.

regulation_5_major_penalties.title: Major Penalties
penalties: Initiation of police action against the student in case of criminal act or moral turpitude
Prohibiting the student from appearing in Semester End Examinations for the course(s)
Detention for a semester or more
Rustication from the University or its institutions for one year or more
Permanent rustication from Indus University or its institutions
Collective punishment if individual raggers are not identified
Mention of ragging punishment in the student's migration certificate
Any other major penalty deemed appropriate by the Director of Indus University

regulation_6_and_7_minor_penalties.title: Minor Penalties
regulation_6_and_7_minor_penalties.description: For indisciplinary actions not covered under major penalties, the Head of the Institution is competent to impose minor penalties after hearing the student.
penalties: Special assignments as decided by the Head of the Institution
Putting the student on conduct probation for an appropriate period
Prohibiting the student from appearing in Mid Semester/Mid Term/Block Semester Examinations in particular subjects
Suspension from attending classes for not more than one week
Any other minor penalty deemed appropriate by the Director
regulation_6_and_7_minor_penalties.note: These minor penalty provisions do not apply to students who have used unfair means in examinations; separate academic regulations govern those cases.

enclosure_1_declaration.title: Declaration by Student at Time of Admission
enclosure_1_declaration.purpose: Student declares they will abide by all disciplinary rules of Indus University and acknowledges they are subject to major/minor penalties for violations.

enclosure_2_anti_ragging_declaration.title: Student Declaration for Not Involving in Ragging Activities
enclosure_2_anti_ragging_declaration.purpose: Student declares they are aware of the University's approach towards ragging and the punishment they will face if found guilty.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What is ragging as defined by Indus University?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Ragging is any disorderly conduct — spoken, written, or by action — that teases, handles with rudeness, or causes annoyance, hardship, or psychological harm to a fresher or junior student. It also includes asking a student to perform something they would not ordinarily do, causing shame or embarrassment that affects their physique or psyche.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Is ragging allowed at Indus University?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: No. Ragging in any form is strictly prohibited at Indus University — inside the campus, classroom, bus, hostel, or even outside the campus. A student found guilty of ragging may be expelled from the institute/university, and the punishment will be mentioned in their migration certificate.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What documents must students submit at the time of admission?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Students must submit two declarations: (1) Enclosure-1 — a general Declaration accepting disciplinary jurisdiction of the Institute, and (2) Enclosure-2 — an Anti-Ragging Declaration stating they are aware of the University's approach to ragging and the punishment for it. Both must be signed by the student and their parent/guardian.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What is the minimum attendance required at Indus University?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The minimum attendance required is 80% in each subject. Students with less than 80% attendance are not eligible to write the Semester End Examinations. For scholarship eligibility, attendance must be more than 90%.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What happens if I am absent for 3 consecutive days without leave?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: If a student is absent for 3 or more consecutive days without leave, their name will be removed from the rolls. This results in forfeiture of all attendance up to the date of re-admission.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Can I be marked absent even if I came to college?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Yes. If you are more than 5 minutes late to a class, you will not be given attendance for that period. Also, students without an Identity Card or proper uniform will be marked absent.

chatbot_training_qa.question: How do I apply for leave at Indus University?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: You must submit a leave application in the prescribed form well in advance, or at least one day before the leave. If prior permission is not possible due to an emergency, the leave application must be submitted on the day of your return. Absence due to illness requires a medical certificate; other absences require a leave application from the parent/guardian.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Are mobile phones allowed on campus?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: No. Use of mobile phones is strictly prohibited in classrooms, corridors, inside blocks, and anywhere on the University campus premises. Any misuse of mobile phones or internet/intranet is also strictly prohibited.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Can I participate in or organise political activities on campus?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: No. Students must not involve themselves directly or indirectly in any form of politics inside or outside the college during their study period. Violation of this rule may result in rustication from the Institute.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What are the consequences of damaging University property?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Damaging University or Institute property (moveable or immoveable) is a major indisciplinary act. The student will be required to pay for the damage and may face major penalties including rustication.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What are the major penalties that can be imposed on a student?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Major penalties include: police action for criminal acts, prohibition from appearing in Semester End Examinations, detention for a semester or more, rustication for one year or more, permanent rustication from Indus University, collective punishment for unidentified raggers, and mention of the ragging punishment in the migration certificate.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What are the minor penalties that can be imposed on a student?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Minor penalties include: a warning, special assignments, imposition of a fine, conduct probation, prohibition from appearing in Mid Semester/Mid Term Examinations in specific subjects, suspension from attending classes for up to one week, and any other appropriate minor penalty decided by the Director.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What is the procedure when a student is found guilty of a major disciplinary violation?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The student is first suspended from classes and academic activities. A Fact Finding Committee investigates within one week. If charges are prima-facie proved, the case goes to a University-level committee appointed by the Registrar. If gross misconduct is confirmed, a Show Cause Notice is issued to the student. After receiving the student's reply, the Registrar takes the final decision on the penalty.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Can I hold a meeting or function in the University campus?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: No meeting or function of any kind can be held in the University premises without written permission from the Principal. Similarly, no notice can be circulated or displayed without written permission of the Director or Head of the Institute.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Are alcohol and drugs allowed in the hostel or on campus?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: No. Possession, consumption, or carrying of liquor, intoxicants, illicit drugs, or narcotics anywhere in the University campus or hostel premises is strictly prohibited. Violations will be dealt with under the strictest University rules and applicable state laws.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Can hostel students stay out overnight?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Hostel students must not stay overnight outside the hostel without written permission from the official designated by the Head of the Institution. The student must provide in writing the address and phone number of the place they will be staying.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Can boys enter the girls' hostel rooms?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: No. Under no circumstances can boys and girls enter each other's rooms. They may interact only in the designated areas decided by the Competent Authority.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What should I do if something is stolen from my hostel room?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Any theft must be immediately reported to the Warden and Director of the Institution. Security of personal belongings is the student's own responsibility; students must ensure they lock their rooms properly before leaving.

chatbot_training_qa.question: When must final year students vacate the hostel?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Final year students must vacate the hostel within 7 days from the date of completion of their final examination. If they fail to do so, a daily charge per room will be levied as decided by the Registrar.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What is the library fine for an overdue book?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: The overdue fine is 50 paisa per day per book. A student with overdue books will not be allowed to use the library until the book is returned and the fine is paid.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Do I need to clear library dues before appearing in exams?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Yes. Students must return all library books before receiving their Hall Ticket for the End Semester Examination. A No Due clearance certificate from the Librarian is mandatory. Provisional Diploma and Certificate will also be issued only after all dues are cleared.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What happens if I lose or damage a library book?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: If a library book is damaged and replacement is not possible, four times the value of the book/property will be collected from the student. Writing on, making marks on, or tampering with library books is also a serious offense.

chatbot_training_qa.question: How many times can I renew a library book?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: A book may be renewed for an additional fortnight, provided no other reader has requested it. A maximum of 2 consecutive renewals are allowed for the same book.

chatbot_training_qa.question: What happens if I lose my library ticket?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: If you lose your library ticket, you must follow the stipulated process and pay a fine of Rs. 50 to get a replacement ticket. If you later find the original ticket, you must return it immediately.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Is helmet compulsory for two-wheeler riders at Indus University?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Yes. Wearing a helmet is compulsory for all students who ride a two-wheeler to and from the campus.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Who has the final authority in disciplinary matters at Indus University?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: All disciplinary powers are vested in the Executive President (VC) and Registrar of Indus University. Their decision is final in all matters of student punishment for violation of rules and regulations.

chatbot_training_qa.question: Where do I submit a complaint or grievance?
chatbot_training_qa.answer: Complaints and grievances may be submitted individually in writing to the Registrar or Director/Head of the Institute through the concerned HOD or the Discipline-cum-Grievance Committee.
